settings.custom_liquid:
You’re in search of healthy, glowing skin –

let’s face it, we all are. You type in ‘How do I get rid of wrinkles’, ‘How do I get rid of spots?’, How do I make my skin glow?’ to Google and get served a variety of articles all selling you the latest cult beauty product. This could be retinol, hyaluronic acid, azelaic acid or a whole variety of things. The problem is that these products are all chemicals, and they have side-effects. Yes, retinol, when used in moderation can help your skin against ageing but have you ever thought about what happens when the chemical balance of your skin isn’t balanced anymore? How is the retinol working to help slow-down the ageing process?

If you’re using retinol, you will already be aware that your skin is more sensitive to the sun. It also makes it more prone to dryness, sensitivity and irritation.

These types of chemical products will aid your skin ailment in question for a period of time, but they are not destined to be used every day for the rest of your lives. Even if you visit a dermatologist and get prescribed medical products for your skin, they are still only designed to be used for short period of time. Due to the harsh nature of these products, you may get rid of acne or redness but then you will find yourself now having to get rid of dry skin and increased sensitivity.

And when you stop using the product, your original skin ailment will reappear, but you will also now be looking for an acne-dry skin-sensitivity skin solution instead.

What does healthy skin mean?

Your skin is a living organ, the largest in the body with a very specific microbiome. The skin microbiome is the collection of microorganisms that live on and within your skin. Harsh chemicals can alter this microbiome resulting in an imbalance and causing the natural make-up of your skin to be upset resulting in skin issues. Think about that perfect soft, smooth skin you see on babies – their microbiome has not been altered by the environment, hormones or chemicals.
So, when we see people talking and searching for glowing, smooth skin what they are really searching for is healthy skin. Skin that has the ideal microbiome balance.
Shop Our Recovery & Repair Gel

What are the side-effects of skincare products?
There are many side-effects of your daily skincare regimen that you may or may not be aware of. These can range from tightness, redness, increased sensitivity or irritation. You may suddenly find you have dry skin patches or blemishes appearing on previously unaffected skin. If you are treating your skin for a more specific concern such as acne or rosacea you may find more specific side-effects such as those detailed below.

The Side Effects of Acne Treatments

The Side Effects of Acne Treatments Chemical treatments for acne, while they may provide an immediate relief, often come with side-effects. These side-effects can vary from debilitating stomach cramps and sickness to further skin sensitivity and flare-ups leading you to stop the medication; and the persistent cycle of your acne starts again. Most acne treatments focus on removing toxins and bacteria from the skin, which is important for combating hyper-pigmentation and scarring—but you also need to address inflammation, keep your skin healthy and eliminate factors that could lead to future breakouts. Retinoid products are a common treatment for acne. However, retinoids are highly active ingredients that may irritate your skin and cause redness or peeling. Causing you to stop the treatment and the cycle of breakouts continues again.

The Side Effects of Rosacea Treatments

If you think about it logically, rosacea is a skin condition that makes your skin sensitive. Your skin is more sensitive than others and more affected by external environmental parameters. If you have sensitive skin, there would be guidance around using cleaning products with strong chemicals in them such as detergent, as this may make your hands flare up – this is the same for your face. Although you may get a faster result by using chemical products, the results are not sustainable. You cannot use medicated cream every day for the rest of your life or take tablets every day. The medicated products will work very quickly because they physically constrict the blood vessels to your face. Due to the harsh nature of these chemicals, you will see multiple side-effects such as dry skin, irritation, soreness not to mention stomach cramps, sickness, headaches. The same as it wouldn’t be wise to take paracetamol on a daily basis, it would not be wise to use a cream that physically restricts your blood vessels every day. When you stop using the cream or taking the tablets, your rosacea will flare-up again and you will find yourself in a constant cycle of bad skin and emotional dissatisfaction. .

How do I combat these side-effects?
The best way to combat the side-effects of skincare products or treatments is to use a natural product, one that does not upset the microbiome of your skin but works to improve it – taking it back to basics.

Red Algae is basically a superfood for your skin – containing higher quantities of all those medically charged buzzwords such as Azelaic acid but with no side-effects. Forget treatments that cause redness and dryness, flare-ups or even raging sensitivity: think about something sustainable—both physically and mentally.

One of the main ‘powers’ of red algae is the fact that it’s a super antioxidant. Red algae in the deep ocean would have been destroyed by ultraviolet light without a powerful antioxidant. In order to survive these ultraviolet radiations, the algae has evolved a bioactive compound called Astaxanthin - nature's strongest known antioxidant.

The ability for it to act as an antioxidant means it is able to protect your cells and therefore your skin from external environmental stressors such as pollution, temperature, sensitivity, therefore improving the appearance of your skin. We’ve created a Recovery & Repair gel using red algae and other natural ingredients, to improve the micro-biome of your skin. It’s natural so there are no side-effects.

Because there are no side-effects from using our gel, it means that you can use our gel forever, to combat a variety of skin complaints. You can use it to keep redness at bay, while acting as a super hydrator, helping to diminish wrinkles and give you a healthy glow. You don’t need to stop the treatment because of side-effects such as dryness or sensitivity because the more you use our gel, the healthier your skin becomes.

There, we have it, we’ve broken the cycle of bad skin. What’s next? .

Watch the process of healthy, glowing skin unveil itself

settings.heading: 28 days
settings.description:
Your skin will retain moisture & increase hydration by an average of 17%-resulting in a shinier, smoother and even skin tone.

Redness and inflammation will have decreased by an average of 20%.

Bumps, blemishes and acne will have diminished in size.

Astaxanthin, the bioactive compound in red algae is a strong antioxidant, this in combination with your SPF will protect your skin from premature ageing and the onset of fine lines and wrinkles.

settings.heading: 56 days
settings.description:
Your skin will be less prone to breakouts because of the powerful Astaxanthin, the bio-active compound in red algae, which can limit external stressorssuch as reactive oxidative species, the skin’s reaction to temperature, pollution and humidity.

By now, you will see a significant reduction in redness & inflammation.

Previous bumps, blemishes and acne will be less visible, you will have less new breakouts and previous scarring will become less visible.

The skin regained its healthy colorand will feel soft, supple and smooth

settings.heading: 84 days
settings.description:
Acne, blemishes & bumps will disappear.

The skin is plump, glowing & smooth.

The skin is clear and congestion free.

The skin's barrier is strong and resilient.

Dark spots & hyperpigmentation will begin to fade.

Wrinkles and fine lines will be reduced.
